channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Zelensky, With Limited Options, Seeks a Path Forward for Ukraine
item.description: A muted response to Ukraine’s “victory plan” and steep challenges on the battlefield leave Kyiv searching for a Plan B.

item.title: Houthi Arrests of Yemenis on Spying Charges Alarm Diplomats and Aid Workers
item.description: The Iran-backed Houthi militia has detained dozens of Yemenis linked to the U.S. Embassy or international organizations recently.

item.title: Zelensky, With Limited Options, Seeks a Path Forward for Ukraine
item.description: A muted response to Ukraine’s “victory plan” and steep challenges on the battlefield leave Kyiv searching for a Plan B.

item.title: Stephen Bannon Is Released From Prison
item.description: Mr. Bannon, one of the most influential voices in hard-right American politics, predicted a legal battle after Election Day that could last weeks or m...

item.title: Trump’s ally Steve Bannon released after spending 4 months in prison for contempt of Congress
item.description: Bannon, 70, reported to the prison July 1 after the Supreme Court rejected his bid to delay the prison sentence while he appeals his conviction.

item.title: British oil giant BP profits slump amid decline in oil refining margins
item.description: BP flagged to markets that its latest earnings would take a sizeable hit after oil prices have fallen on concerns over Chinese demand and the prospect...

item.title: How Autocrats Game the Rules of Democracy
item.description: All around the world, leaders are exploiting legal and electoral systems in an attempt to win more power. What does it take to beat them?

item.title: Hezbollah Names Naim Qassem as Its New Leader
item.description: Mr. Qassem had been the Lebanese militant group’s longtime deputy. He replaces Hassan Nasrallah, who was assassinated in an Israeli airstrike last mon...

item.title: Foreign Election Interference, and Volkswagen May Close Factories
item.description: Plus, why you should never cross a crow.

item.title: Forget China, fashion empires are facing an even greater risk from ‘luxury fatigue’ according to Chanel exec
item.description: Frederic Grangie, head of the watch and jewelry division at Chanel, said the following years will be "complicated" for the luxury industry.

item.title: Houthi Arrests of Yemenis on Spying Charges Alarm Diplomats and Aid Workers
item.description: The Iran-backed Houthi militia has detained dozens of Yemenis linked to the U.S. Embassy or international organizations recently.

item.title: Apple Intelligence rollout has customers complaining
item.description: They had to join a waitlist before receiving the promised AI-powered features.

item.description: Mr. Qassem had been the Lebanese militant group’s longtime deputy. He replaces Hassan Nasrallah, who was assassinated in an Israeli airstrike last mon...

item.title: JPMorgan is suing the customers who cashed in on bank’s ‘infinite money glitch’
item.description: JPMorgan is reportedly attempting to recoup more than $661,000 of ill-gotten funds.

item.title: Live Updates: Dozens Killed in Israeli Strike in Northern Gaza, Palestinian Officials Say
item.description: The Israeli military said it was looking into reports of the attack. The Palestinian Civil Defense, an emergency service, said at least 55 people were...
